home.title: Mixed Methods Based Protein Domain Prediction System
home.desc: MM-PDPS(Mixed Methods Based Protein Domain Prediction System) is a web server for protein domain prediction. It integrates multiple methods to predict protein domain boundaries, including the domain conservation score, the secondary structure, the relative solvent accessibility, the accessible surface area, and domain functions. The server also provides a user-friendly interface for users to edit the predicted domain boundaries and to detect the discontinuous domains.

form.seqHolder: Please input the raw format sequence with length ≥ 80
form.seqTip: Please input the sequence with length ≥ 80
form.seqFormatError: Amino acid sequences can only contain ACDEFGHIKLMNPQRSTVWY
form.seqLenError: Please select a file with sequence length ≥ 80
form.nameHolder: Please input the protein sequence name
form.name: Sequence Name

search.seqHolder: Please input the EXACT sequence you submitted

result.single: It is a Single Protein Domain

explanations.target: Visualization of the input sequence with the predicted domain segments shown in different colors
explanations.score: Deduced from multiple threading alignments. It allows the user to move the horizontal line to change the cutoff; or to move the vertical line to refine the boundary; or add new boundary by right-click
explanations.secStructure: The predicted secondary structure by NetSurfP2 which can be used as reference to refine the boundaries
explanations.rsa: The predicted relative solvent accessibility which can be used together with predicted secondary structure to refine the boundaries
explanations.asa: The predicted accessible surface area which can be used together with predicted secondary structure to refine the boundaries
explanations.predict: The domain segment predicted by the Domain Conversation Score with the default cutoff
explanations.dcd: Boundaries optimization or discontinuous protein domains detection by the boundary cluster methods based on the predicted boundaries
explanations.boundaryUser: Change or refinement of the predicted boundaries by the users. The change can be saved, rollbacked or initiated. Furthermore, it also allows the user to re-detect the discontinuous domains according to user’s editing by clicking the DCD Detect button
explanations.dcdUser: The server will re-detect the discontinuous domains if there are not less than 3 segments after the user's edit. The DCD detection by the boundary clustering method is very fast. If the boundary clustering method does not detect discontinuous domains, DomEX will be used to further detect. It will take about 2-5 hours to detect the putative discontinuous domains with DomEx, which need search a library with 23,671,485 single domain sequences for each putative domain by Blast+
